item.title: Case: 185
item.dc:creator: @wasabiie wasabiie
item.description:
@wasabiie wrote:

I know what duplicate case is… -.-

But I’ll try it, if I get another problem I’ll post here again.

@Marc HAI DER MARC!

this is what I get when I search Actionbuttonid

public int actionButtonId = 0; public boolean actionset = false;

case 130: //Clicking some stuff in game int interfaceID = inStream.readUnsignedWordA(); if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("lulttredbish.")) println_debug("Case 130: "+actionButtonId); if (tradeStatus >= 2) { PlayerHandler.players[tradeWith].tradeOtherDeclined = true; DeclineTrade(); sendMessage("You decline the trade."); }

And I think I just found my problem lmao.

println_debug("Case 130: "+actionButtonId);

Read full topic

item.title: Case: 185
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

You didn’t delete correctly then.

Delete all the way to the default case, once there:

there is a break; under the bracket that ends the switch, you highlight up to the break; then delete it.

Duplicate case means you have the same case more than once.

[quote=“hippie, post:7, topic:180359”]To your printing = lag question, I set a batch to infinatly print I R MAKE LAG

Instantly my cpus maxed and it took a sec or two for the batch to close.

Just to let you in on the extent of that

@Tyler, try searching +actionButtonId[/quote]

Difference from infinitely and a couple of 100 times.

Read full topic

item.title: Case: 185
item.dc:creator: @wasabiie wasabiie
item.description:
@wasabiie wrote:

case 185: //clicking most buttons actionButtonId = misc.HexToInt(inStream.buffer, 0, packetSize); if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("dno")) println_debug("Case 185: "+actionButtonId); switch(actionButtonId) {

on my server command promt it keeps saying case 185, making it lag, and I’m wondering if I deleate this line to fix it. println_debug("Case 185: "+actionButtonId); [br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 10, 2008, 02:25:41 PM[/size][hr]help?!?
